short_description: Hong Kong's central business hub with skyscrapers and government offices
Vibrant commercial area with nightlife, convention centre and shopping
Large residential district with Quarry Bay and industrial areas
Beach district featuring Repulse Bay, Stanley and Ocean Park
Tourist heart of Kowloon: Tsim Sha Tsui, Mong Kok, shopping
Working-class area famous for electronics and street food markets
Historic district with Thai food and former airport site
Residential area known for famous Sik Sik Yuen temple
Former industrial zone now commercial with malls and promenade
Container port and industrial area including Tsing Yi island
New Territories gateway with big malls and traditional markets
Northwest town with beaches, Gold Coast and public housing
Rural district with wetlands, villages and growing new towns
Border area with Fanling-Sheung Shui shopping and golf courses
Scenic district with waterfront park, market and science park
Major new town with racecourse, mall and universities
Hong Kong's back garden: country parks, beaches, seafood
Largest district: Lantau (Disneyland, Big Buddha), outlying islands
